My friend speaks German.

examples.ru: Времена в немецком языке сложнее, чем в русском.
examples.en: German tenses are more complex than Russian ones.

senses.usage_notes: This word is often used when you want to refer to an unspecified amount of something, typically a small quantity.

examples.en: A few hours passed.

examples.ru: Не́сколько раз я был в Париже.
examples.en: I've been to Paris a few times.
Some students were absent from the lesson.

source.seed_translation: no 1) No, I don’t know. 2) I don’t have a brother. 3) He is not at home.
source.seed_extra_ru: 1) Нет, я не зна́ю. 2) У меня́ нет бра́та. 3) Его́ нет до́ма.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is used as an adjective or adverb, often at the beginning of a sentence.

examples.en: There are no free places.

senses.grammar_hint: The adverb "никогда́" is used to emphasize that something has never happened or will never happen.

examples.ru: Я никогда не была в Италии.
examples.en: I have never been to Italy.

examples.ru: Никогда не сдавайся, даже если всё идёт наперекосяк.
examples.en: Never give up, even if everything goes wrong.

examples.ru: Это никогда не случится со мной.
examples.en: This will never happen to me.

senses.grammar_hint: This pronoun is used to refer to a person or people who are not present, known, or important in the context.

examples.ru: Ни один человек не знает, что случилось.
examples.en: Nobody knows what happened.
No one came to the meeting.

examples.ru: Никто не может ответить на этот вопрос.
examples.en: Nobody can answer this question.

source.seed_extra_ru: только ед.ч. — Его́ зна́ют во всём ми́ре.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used both as a noun and in other contexts to refer to the world or universe.

examples.en: He is famous all over the world.
The world is full of mysteries.
The whole world knows his talent.
He didn't go anywhere.

examples.ru: Не нужно беспокоиться, она уже приехала, никуда не уезжала.
examples.en: There's no need to worry; she already arrived and hasn't left anywhere.

examples.ru: Мы могли бы пойти в кино, но мне действительно никуда не нужно.
examples.en: We could go see a movie, but I really don't need to go anywhere.

senses.grammar_hint: Use 'ничего' when expressing that there is nothing or no amount of something.

examples.en: There's nothing in the bar.
He didn't say a word.
I have nothing.

senses.usage_notes: Use 'но' to connect contrasting ideas or sentences.
senses.grammar_hint: Place 'но' at the beginning of a sentence or after a comma to introduce a contrast.

examples.ru: Я хотел идти в парк, но начал дождь.
examples.en: I wanted to go to the park, but it started raining.
It was interesting, but a bit boring.

examples.ru: Мне нужно было идти в магазин, но не смог найти времени.
examples.en: I needed to go to the store, but I didn't have time.

senses.usage_notes: This adjective is used to describe something that has just been created or that hasn't existed before.
senses.grammar_hint: Remember to use the correct form of the adjective depending on the gender, number, and case of the noun it modifies.

examples.en: New Year.
This is a new computer.
We bought a new house.

senses.grammar_hint: Use нога to refer to a human leg or an animal's leg.

examples.ru: У неё была боль в ноге.
examples.en: She had pain in her leg.

examples.ru: Змея подползла к ним, цепляясь за каждый камень своей длинной ногой.
examples.en: The snake crawled towards them, gripping each stone with its long leg.

examples.ru: Ноги у него были сильные и выносливые.
examples.en: His legs were strong and sturdy.
He opened a can with a knife.
Mom cut the potatoes with a knife.
The knife was in its sheath.

source.seed_translation: number, room 1) home number 2) hotel room

senses.grammar_hint: This noun is inanimate and can take both masculine and neuter forms, but the masculine form is more common.

examples.en: This is my new number.
Write down your phone number.

examples.ru: У меня есть три номера для входа в систему.
examples.en: I have three numbers for system access.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used in various contexts, such as 'вчера я читал новость о пожаре' (Yesterday I read news about a fire).

examples.ru: Я смотрю телевизор, чтобы узнать новость.
examples.en: I watch TV to know the news.
The news shocked all the participants very much.

examples.ru: Вчера я читал новость о победе сборной России на чемпионате мира.
examples.en: Yesterday I read the news about Russia's national team winning the world championship.

senses.usage_notes: This adjective can describe people, objects, or situations that are considered usual or standard.

examples.ru: У него нормальный вкус в музыке.
examples.en: He has a normal taste in music.

examples.ru: Этот продукт имеет нормальные сроки годности.
examples.en: This product has normal expiration dates.
She was always a normal child.

senses.usage_notes: This word is used to describe the time of night when it is dark outside.

examples.en: At night
The night was cold.

examples.ru: Мы встречались с ним в ночь на пятницу.
examples.en: We met him at the stroke of Friday.

senses.grammar_hint: This adverb is used to indicate the time of night in a sentence.

examples.en: He walks through the city at night.

examples.ru: Ночью всё кажется таким тихим и спокойным.
examples.en: At night, everything seems so quiet and peaceful.
We met at night in the parking lot.

senses.grammar_hint: November is used as a standalone noun without any grammatical gender in Russian.

examples.en: In November, the temperature starts to drop.

examples.ru: Мой день рождения в этом месяце - ноября.
examples.en: My birthday is in this month - November.

examples.ru: В ноябре мы обычно проводим ежегодную ярмарку.
examples.en: In November, we usually hold the annual fair.

source.seed_extra_ru: (нра́влюсь, нра́вишься) нсв II — понра́виться (понра́влюсь, понра́вишься) св II + инф.

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is used in the impersonal form, meaning 'it pleases' or 'it is pleasing'.

examples.en: I like music.
We like these books.
He does not like this idea.

senses.grammar_hint: This adjective is used to express necessity or requirement in a sentence.

examples.ru: Это ну́жен новый компьютер для работы.
examples.en: A new computer is needed for work.

examples.ru: Нам ну́жен ответственный человек на эту должность.
examples.en: We need a responsible person for this position.

examples.ru: Урок начинается в восемь, и вам ну́жен час для того, чтобы приготовиться.
examples.en: The lesson starts at eight, and you will need an hour to get ready.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'нужно' is used as a stand-alone expression to convey necessity or obligation.

examples.en: We need to go to the store.
He needed to see a doctor.
Children need to play a lot.

senses.grammar_hint: This verb can be used in both present and future tenses, e.g., 'Я обедаю в баре' (I am dining in a bar) or 'Мы будем обедать завтра' (We will dine tomorrow).

examples.en: The food is tasty when you dine at home.

examples.ru: Мы будем обедать в кафе после работы.
examples.en: We will dine in a cafe after work.

senses.usage_notes: Can be used to introduce a topic or subject of discussion.

examples.en: You should read about the book.
They talk a lot about him.
What are you thinking about?
He bought new shoes.

examples.ru: Обувь должна быть удобной и соответствовать форме стопы.
examples.en: Shoes should be comfortable and fit the shape of your foot.

examples.ru: Я оставил обувь в гардеробе, когда пришел в бассейн.
examples.en: I left my shoes at the cloakroom when I came to the swimming pool.
Students live in a hostel.

examples.ru: В университете есть хорошее общежитие для студентов-иностранцев.
examples.en: The university has a good hostel for foreign students.

examples.ru: Я снимал комнату в общежитии, когда учился в колледже.
examples.en: I lived in a dorm when I was in college.

senses.grammar_hint: 通常用于句子开头或中间，表示习惯性的行为。

examples.en: I usually wake up early.
The weather is usually sunny here.
We usually meet at the café.

senses.usage_notes: Often used in official or formal contexts.

examples.en: You must come.
This is mandatory for you.
Always follow the instructions.

senses.grammar_hint: Plural form of "овощ" (vegetable) is used when referring to multiple vegetables.

examples.ru: Мне нужно купить овощи для супа.
examples.en: I need to buy vegetables for soup.
There are fresh vegetables in the refrigerator.

examples.ru: Он любит готовить, используя разные овощи.
examples.en: He likes to cook using various vegetables.

senses.grammar_hint: This noun is inanimate, so it does not take the genitive case after negation words like 'не' (not).

examples.ru: У неё есть одежда для занятий спортом.
examples.en: She has clothes for sports.

examples.ru: Я приготовил новую одежду для своего сына.
examples.en: I bought new clothes for my son.

senses.grammar_hint: Use 'один' with singular nouns, e.g., один день (one day).

examples.en: One person came to the meeting.

examples.ru: У меня один ключ от дома.
examples.en: I have one key to the house.
One of the students was late today.

senses.grammar_hint: This numeral is used to count items or people, for example: 'У меня одиннадцать книг' (I have eleven books).

examples.en: Midnight at eleven.
She is eleven years old.
There are eleven chairs in the room.

senses.grammar_hint: окно is a noun that can be used in both singular and plural forms, but the plural form is rarely used.

examples.en: I closed the window.
The windows in the room are open.

examples.ru: У меня на столе стоит цветок у окна.
examples.en: There is a flower on my desk next to the window.

senses.grammar_hint: Use 'обед' when referring to the midday meal or lunch.

examples.en: I prepared lunch.

examples.ru: Мы встретились на обеде в ресторане.
examples.en: We met for lunch at a restaurant.

examples.ru: Обед будет подан в половине первого.
examples.en: Lunch will be served at half past one.

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is used in the imperfective aspect, so it can be combined with time expressions like 'вчера', 'сегодня', 'завтра'.

examples.en: I finished school.

examples.ru: Он будет окончивать работу в три часа.
examples.en: He will be finishing the work at three o'clock.
We have already finished the lunch break.
We are planning a vacation in October.

examples.ru: Октябрь — это хороший месяц для посещения Европы.
examples.en: October is a good month to visit Europe.

examples.ru: Нашему ребенку满10个月了，我们决定给他过生日，就在十月。
examples.en: Our child had been full 10 months, so we decided to have their birthday party in October.

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is reflexive, indicated by the reflexive pronoun 'сам(我自己)', which is often omitted in casual speech.

examples.en: I am late for work.

examples.ru: Не опаздывай, я приеду за тобой.
examples.en: Don't be late, I'll come to pick you up.
He is always late for meetings.

senses.grammar_hint: Use 'он' as a subject pronoun to refer to male individuals in sentences.

examples.en: He came home late.
He likes playing football.
He is going to work.
She loves opera.

examples.ru: Недавно я посмотрел опера в театре.
examples.en: Recently, I watched an opera at the theater.
This is a classic work of opera.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is used as an adverbial modifier in a sentence, indicating when something happens.

examples.en: I often take walks in autumn.
In autumn, we have a lot of leaf fall.
The park is beautiful in autumn.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'остановка' is a feminine noun in Russian.

examples.en: We stop at the metro station.

examples.ru: Он опоздал, потому что пропустил свою остановку.
examples.en: He was late because he missed his stop.

examples.ru: В автобусе всегда есть остановки для пассажиров.
examples.en: There are always stops in the bus for passengers.

senses.grammar_hint: The adverb 'осторожно' is often used to describe actions or behaviors that are done with caution or care.

examples.en: He moved cautiously, afraid of making a noise.

examples.ru: Пожилая женщина идет по льду осторожно.
examples.en: The elderly woman walks on the ice carefully.

examples.ru: Осторожно берите в руки это стекло, оно хрупкое.
examples.en: Be careful when you handle this glass; it's fragile.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'ответ' is used in both singular and plural forms, but in most cases, it functions as a singular noun.

examples.en: I answered the letter.
He gave no answer.

examples.ru: Ответ на вопрос был найден после нескольких дней работы.
examples.en: The answer to the question was found after several days of work.

senses.grammar_hint: The verb 'отвечать' is used in all tenses to indicate answering or responding to something.

examples.en: I am replying to a letter.

examples.ru: Мы отвечаем на вопросы в конце конференции.
examples.en: We will answer questions at the end of the conference.
He always answers quickly.

source.seed_translation: to take a rest, to have a rest

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is used in infinitive form after certain verbs like 'нужно' (needed) or 'хотят' (want to).

examples.en: We need to rest.
They want to relax at the seaside.

examples.ru: После долгой работы им необходимо было отдыхать.
examples.en: After a long work, they needed to rest.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used to refer to one's biological father or a male parent figure in a family.

examples.en: Father is a doctor.
I love my father.

examples.ru: Отцы обязаны поддерживать своих детей финансово.
examples.en: Fathers are obligated to financially support their children.

source.seed_extra_ru: нсв I — откры́ть св I (откро́ю, откро́ешь)

senses.usage_notes: This verb can be used in a variety of contexts, from opening a door to starting a process.

examples.en: I open the door.
He opens a jar of jam.

examples.ru: Мы открываем дело по данному факту.
examples.en: We are investigating this matter.
The door was left open.

examples.ru: Он раскрыл свою мысль на всю аудиторию, сделав ее открытой для обсуждения.
examples.en: He opened up his idea to the entire audience, making it available for discussion.

examples.ru: Пожалуйста, не забудьте закрыть окно перед отъездом. Оно оставалось открытой всю ночь.
examples.en: Please don't forget to close the window before you leave. It had been left open all night.

examples.ru: Я купил открытку в почтовом отделении.
examples.en: I bought a postcard at the post office.

examples.ru: Мы отправили друзьям на новогодние праздники красивую открытку.
examples.en: We sent our friends a beautiful postcard for the New Year holiday.

examples.ru: На обратной стороне открытки был рисунок с местными достопримечательностями.
examples.en: There was a picture of local attractions on the back of the postcard.

senses.grammar_hint: Use 'откуда' to ask about the origin or source of something.

examples.en: Where did you come from?
He told where the famous story comes from.

examples.ru: Мы не знаем, откуда взялась эта идея.
examples.en: We don't know where this idea came from.

senses.grammar_hint: This phrase is used to add information or emphasize that something additional follows.

examples.ru: Не только я люблю музыку, но и мой брат.
examples.en: Not only do I love music, but my brother does too.

examples.ru: Не только мы пришли рано, но и принесли подарки.
examples.en: We not only arrived early, but we also brought gifts.

examples.ru: Не только он учится хорошо, но и всегда помогает другим.
examples.en: Not only does he study well, but he always helps others too.

examples.ru: В осень мы любим гулять в лесу.
examples.en: In autumn, we love to walk in the woods.

examples.ru: Осенью листья на деревьях становятся яркими.
examples.en: In autumn, leaves on trees become colorful.

examples.ru: Осень – это прекрасное время для поездок в деревню.
examples.en: Autumn is a great time for trips to the countryside.

examples.ru: Он наткнулся на очки у подъезда.
examples.en: He found some glasses at the entrance.

examples.ru: Мама купила очки дочери для школы.
examples.en: Mom bought glasses for her daughter for school.
Glasses are often called lenses.

senses.grammar_hint: This noun can be used in both singular and plural forms, but typically does not require a plural form unless specifying multiple mistakes.

examples.en: I made a mistake in the calculations.

examples.ru: Не стоит волноваться об одной ошибке.
examples.en: Don't worry about one mistake.

examples.ru: Ошибки помогают нам учиться и развиваться.
examples.en: Mistakes help us learn and develop.

examples.ru: Он надел пальто и вышел на улицу.
examples.en: He put on his coat and went outside.

examples.ru: Этот пальто подходит ей очень хорошо.
examples.en: This coat fits her very well.

examples.ru: Она выбирает пальто по качеству, а не по моде.
examples.en: She chooses coats based on quality rather than fashion.

examples.ru: В центре города стоит памятник героям войны.
examples.en: There is a monument to the war heroes in the city center.

examples.ru: Памятник был установлен в честь победы над немецкими захватчиками.
examples.en: The monument was erected in honor of victory over German invaders.

examples.ru: Мы пришли на выставку памятников из разных городов.
examples.en: We went to an exhibition of monuments from different cities.

senses.grammar_hint: Use очень before adjectives or other adverbs to intensify their meaning.

examples.en: He is a very smart student.
This is very delicious food.
I really love this song.

senses.grammar_hint: This word is commonly used in both formal and informal contexts, often referring to one's father or a close male friend.

examples.en: Daddy cooked me lunch.

examples.ru: Мы с папой пошли в парк играть.
examples.en: Me and daddy went to the park to play.

examples.ru: Папа всегда помогает мне с домашними заданиями.
examples.en: Daddy always helps me with homework.

senses.grammar_hint: This adjective is used to indicate that something comes before others in order or time.

examples.en: The first day of the week is Monday.

examples.ru: У меня первый класс сегодня в десять утра.
examples.en: I have my first class today at ten in the morning.
It was very exciting the first time.
He works as a translator.
My friend is a freelance translator.

examples.ru: У меня есть опыт работы переводчиком.
examples.en: I have experience working as a translator.

examples.ru: Во время перерыва я выпил чашку кофе.
examples.en: During the break, I had a cup of coffee.
The break will last about half an hour.

examples.ru: После перерыва мы продолжим работу над проектом.
examples.en: After the break, we will continue working on the project.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'песня' is a feminine noun in Russian.

examples.en: She loves to sing songs.

examples.ru: Песня была очень популярной в то время.
examples.en: The song was very popular at that time.

examples.ru: Я слышал эту песню на радио.
examples.en: I heard this song on the radio.

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is used in infinitive form without 'to' before it.

examples.en: I love to sing.
Singing brings joy.
We are going to sing on Sunday.

senses.grammar_hint: This noun is in the nominative case, so it does not change form for other cases.

examples.en: I drink beer with friends.

examples.ru: У меня есть маленькая бутылка пива.
examples.en: I have a small bottle of beer.
I don't like cold beer.

senses.usage_notes: Used to refer to someone who writes books, articles, or other written works.

examples.ru: Он стал писателем после того как написал первую книгу.
examples.en: He became a writer after he wrote his first book.

examples.ru: Мой отец всегда мечтал стать писателем, но он никогда этого не сделал.
examples.en: My father always wanted to be a writer, but he never did it.

examples.ru: Она пишет писательский роман в свободное время.
examples.en: She writes a literary novel in her free time.

examples.ru: Мы прошли переход между двух зданий.
examples.en: We passed between two buildings.
The passage was closed for repairs.

examples.ru: Я не видел перехода через реку.
examples.en: I didn't see a bridge over the river.

senses.grammar_hint: This verb can be used in both present tense (писаю) and past tense (писал).

examples.en: I am writing a letter.
He was writing a novel all year.
Come tomorrow, I will be writing.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'паспорт' is a masculine noun in Russian, so it takes masculine adjectives and agrees with masculine gender in sentences.

examples.en: I have a passport.
He showed his passport to the police.
Make sure you have your passport.

senses.grammar_hint: Пианино is used as a singular noun in Russian, just like in English.

examples.en: I play the piano.

examples.ru: У неё есть собственное пианино в спальне.
examples.en: She has her own piano in the bedroom.

examples.ru: Мы купили детское пианино для нашей дочери.
examples.en: We bought a child's piano for our daughter.
He received a letter from a friend.

examples.ru: Не отправляйте мне так много писем.
examples.en: Don't send me so many letters.

examples.ru: В письме говорилось о поездке в Европу.
examples.en: The letter was about a trip to Europe.

senses.grammar_hint: This verb can be used in both present and past tenses, for example: 'Я пью кофе' (I am drinking coffee) or 'Я пил воду' (I drank water).

examples.ru: Мама всегда пьет чай перед обедом.
examples.en: Mom always drinks tea before lunch.

examples.ru: Он уже выпил кофе, когда пришел на работу.
examples.en: He had already drunk coffee when he came to work.

examples.ru: Пейте воды, если вы чувствуете себя уставшим.
examples.en: Drink water if you feel tired.

senses.usage_notes: This word can refer to a public green space or an area designated for recreation and leisure activities.

examples.ru: Я хожу на прогулку в парке.
examples.en: I go for a walk in the park.

examples.ru: В нашем городе есть большой парк с фонтанами и лодочным двориком.
examples.en: In our city, there is a large park with fountains and a boating area.

examples.ru: Парк открыт для всех желающих посетить его в любое время года.
examples.en: The park is open to everyone who wishes to visit it at any time of the year.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used in both formal and informal contexts.

examples.ru: У меня есть план на выходные.
examples.en: I have a plan for the weekend.

examples.ru: Мы придумали план действий, чтобы решить эту проблему.
examples.en: We came up with a plan of action to solve this problem.

examples.ru: Мой брат никогда не делает планов на будущее.
examples.en: My brother never makes plans for the future.

senses.usage_notes: This noun can be used in both singular and plural forms, but there is no distinct form for the plural.

examples.en: This dress is very beautiful.

examples.ru: Я купила новое платье на вечеринку.
examples.en: I bought a new dress for the party.
My sister wears a long dress.

senses.grammar_hint: This adjective is used with masculine, neuter, or plural nouns. It does not change form in the plural.

examples.en: This movie is bad.
He has a bad character.
Bad news: we are late.

examples.ru: Трансляция шоу началась в 8 часов вечера.
examples.en: The broadcast of the show started at 8 p.m.
The transmission went smoothly.
I was listening to a radio broadcast in the car.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'площадь' is a feminine noun in Russian, often used with the preposition 'на'.

examples.ru: Мы стояли на берегу реки, смотря вдаль.

examples.ru: Ты должен стоять под ливнем, чтобы увидеть радугу.
examples.en: You have to stand in the rain to see a rainbow.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'страна' is feminine, so it requires feminine adjectives.

examples.ru: Она часто путешествует по разным странам.
examples.en: She often travels to different countries.

examples.ru: Моя страна известна своими пейзажами и культурой.
examples.en: My country is known for its landscapes and culture.

examples.ru: Я люблю жить в своей маленькой стране.
examples.en: I love living in my little country.
This is a page of the website.

examples.ru: Я нахожусь на третьей странице книги.
examples.en: I am on the third page of the book.

examples.ru: Страницы книги часто имеют разные размеры.
examples.en: Book pages often have different sizes.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'сок' is used as a singular noun, does not change form for gender or number.

examples.en: I am drinking juice.
Mom gave the child some juice.
There are many different juices in the fridge.

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is used in its infinitive form without 'to' before verbs in English, e.g., 'I want to build a house.'

examples.en: They are building a new bridge.
We built the house all winter.

examples.ru: Мне нужно строить проект к завтрашнему дню.
examples.en: I need to build a project by tomorrow.
I work in the canteen.
The children have lunch in the canteen.
The canteen is closed for repairs.

senses.grammar_hint: This adjective is used to describe things related to students or student life, often in plural form as a descriptive noun.

examples.en: Student dormitory.

examples.ru: Слушайте лекции внимательно, ведь это студенческий опыт.
examples.en: Listen to the lectures attentively, as this is a student experience.

examples.ru: Студенческая жизнь полна приключений и открытий.
examples.en: Student life is full of adventures and discoveries.
She placed the plate on the chair.

examples.ru: Я устроился в кресле и посмотрел фильм.
examples.en: I settled in the armchair and watched a movie.

examples.ru: В комнате стоял только один стул.
examples.en: The room had only one chair.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'суббота' is a feminine noun in Russian, and it does not change its form for grammatical cases in the nominative case.

examples.ru: Сегодня суббота, и мы пошли в парк.
examples.en: It's Saturday today, and we went to the park.
An important meeting is scheduled for Saturday.

examples.ru: Суббота - это день отдыха и встреч с друзьями.
examples.en: Saturday is a day of rest and hanging out with friends.

examples.ru: Я купил сувенир на память о поездке в Париж.
examples.en: I bought a souvenir to remember my trip to Paris.

examples.ru: Сувенирная лавка была полна интересными вещами.
examples.en: The souvenirs shop was full of interesting things.

examples.ru: Он подарил ей сувенир из своего путешествия в Азию.
examples.en: He gave her a souvenir from his trip to Asia.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'суп' is a noun and can be used in both singular and plural forms without changing its spelling.

examples.en: I ate soup.
Mom is cooking a tasty soup.

examples.ru: У нас на обед будет суп и омлет.
examples.en: For lunch we will have soup and an omelette.

senses.grammar_hint: This adjective is in masculine form. It agrees with masculine nouns it modifies.

examples.en: He is a lucky person.

examples.ru: Ее счастливый билет выиграл миллион рублей.
examples.en: Her lucky ticket won one million rubles.

examples.ru: Это было ее счастливое время в жизни.
examples.en: That was her lucky time in life.

senses.usage_notes: This noun typically doesn't change form in Russian, so there's no need to worry about gender or case.

examples.en: He always strived for happiness.

examples.ru: У неё было счастье найти хорошую работу.
examples.en: She was lucky to find a good job.
Happiness often comes unexpectedly.

senses.grammar_hint: Use сюда to indicate a destination or direction towards the speaker.

examples.en: Come here.
He came here to work.
Can you put your bag here?
I like cheese on my sandwich.

examples.ru: Покупатель выбрал сыр с красной плесенью.
examples.en: The customer chose the blue cheese.
We serve cheeses at dinner.

senses.usage_notes: Can be used to introduce a result or consequence.

examples.ru: Так он и пришёл домой поздно.
examples.en: So he came home late.

examples.ru: Он хорошо подготовился, так что сдал экзамен на отлично.
examples.en: He prepared well, so he passed the exam with flying colors.

examples.ru: Так мы и начали обсуждать эту проблему.
examples.en: So we started discussing this problem.
She has a red bag.

examples.ru: Я купил ей подарок в виде сумки для ноутбука.
examples.en: I bought her a laptop bag as a gift.
She is wearing an old bag hanging from her shoulder.

senses.grammar_hint: This adjective is used to describe someone who has a natural ability in something, such as music or art.

examples.en: He is a talented composer.

examples.ru: Её талантливость заметна в её рисунках.
examples.en: Her talent is evident in her drawings.
My sister is a talented student.

senses.usage_notes: This noun can refer to both male and female students, but in casual speech, 'студент' is commonly used for both genders.

examples.en: I am a university student.
My brother is a student.
Here's a list of students.

senses.grammar_hint: Там is used to indicate a location or place, often in contrast with здесь (here).

examples.en: The books are lying there.
I live at home there.
My dog is running there.

senses.grammar_hint: This verb is used in infinitive form, often preceded by 'to' in English.

examples.en: I love to dance.
We will be dancing all night.
He is learning ballroom dances.

senses.grammar_hint: This adjective is used to show possession, such as 'your book' in Russian.

examples.en: This is your computer.
Your coffee tastes nice.
You forgot your keys.
We went to the theatre.
This play is performed in the theatre.

examples.ru: Я часто хожу на спектакли в этом театре.
examples.en: I often go to plays at this theatre.

senses.usage_notes: Употребляется в различных контекстах, таких как текст документа или разговорный язык.

examples.ru: Я прочитал весь текст статьи за одну ночь.
examples.en: I read the entire article text in one night.

examples.ru: Это простой текст для начинающих учить русский язык.
examples.en: This is a simple text for beginners to learn Russian.

examples.ru: В этом тексте много ошибок ortografii.
examples.en: There are many spelling mistakes in this text.

examples.ru: Я получил телеграмму о смерти моей бабушки.
examples.en: I received a telegram about my grandmother's death.

examples.ru: В старые времена люди часто отправляли телеграммы.
examples.en: In the old days, people often sent telegrams.

examples.ru: Мне не пришлось ждать долго, до меня дошла телеграмма.
examples.en: I didn't have to wait long; I received the telegram.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used in both singular and plural forms, but 'телефоны' is more common when referring to multiple phones.

examples.ru: Я взял телефон и позвонил другу.
examples.en: I took the phone and called a friend.

examples.ru: Мой старый телефон сломался, я купил новый.
examples.en: My old phone broke, I bought a new one.

examples.ru: В офисе каждый имеет свой собственный телефон.
examples.en: In the office, everyone has their own telephone.

senses.grammar_hint: Такси́ is a masculine noun, so it requires the corresponding masculine adjective when describing its state or quality.

examples.en: I took a taxi to the airport.

examples.ru: Это была простая такси́ с хорошим водителем.
examples.en: This was a simple taxi with a good driver.

examples.ru: Я поехал на такси́, потому что мой автомобиль был в ремонте.
examples.en: I went by taxi because my car was in repair.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'сын' is a masculine noun in the nominative case, and its form does not change depending on the number or grammatical gender of other nouns in the sentence.

examples.en: This is my son.
He has three sons.
My son is studying at the university.

senses.usage_notes: This adverb is used to indicate the present time or current situation.

examples.en: Now I have free time.
We are starting now.
He is now grown up.

examples.ru: Ребенок пишет в тетради домашнее задание.
examples.en: The child is doing homework in the copybook.

examples.ru: Учитель раздавал ученикам тетради для рисования.
examples.en: The teacher distributed notebooks for drawing to the students.

examples.ru: Тетрадь нужна для записи важной информации в классе.
examples.en: A notebook is needed for taking important notes in class.

source.seed_translation: quiet, still, calm; quietly; quieter 1) still sound 2) calm weather 3) quiet person
source.seed_extra_ru: (-ая, -ое, -ие); ти́хо сравн.ст. ти́ше 1) ти́хий звук 2) ти́хая пого́да 3) ти́хий челове́к

senses.usage_notes: This adjective is used to describe something that is quiet or calm, often in a soft manner.

examples.en: A quiet day
The calm ocean
A peaceful zoo

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used in both formal and informal contexts.

examples.en: We are good friends.
A colleague invited me to lunch.
This is my friend, he is a doctor.

senses.usage_notes: This particle is used to emphasize agreement or addition, similar to 'also' in English.

examples.en: He came too.
Are you eating too?
I like this book too.

senses.usage_notes: Use 'только' to indicate exclusivity or limitation in a sentence.

examples.en: Only you can do it.
We only go on weekends.
Only he knows the truth.
He plays tennis every day.

examples.ru: Моя сестра учится играть в теннис.
examples.en: My sister is learning to play tennis.
Tennis is a popular sport.

examples.ru: Я часто езжу на трамвае до работы.
examples.en: I often ride the tram to work.

examples.ru: Трамвайная остановка находится рядом с нашим домом.
examples.en: The tram stop is close to our house.

examples.ru: Дети часто играют возле трамвая на перекрестке.
examples.en: Children often play near the tram at the intersection.

senses.grammar_hint: Телевизор is a masculine noun, so it requires the definite article 'этот', 'тот', 'этот', etc., in Russian.

examples.en: I have a TV.
That TV costs a lot.

examples.ru: Я включил телевизор, чтобы посмотреть новость.
examples.en: I turned on the TV to watch the news.

senses.grammar_hint: Use тридцать before singular nouns that begin with a consonant sound.

examples.en: I have thirty rubles.
She is thirty years old.
There are thirty pages in this section.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'три' is used to count or express the number three in Russian.

examples.en: I have three books.

examples.ru: Это три дня в неделю, когда я работаю.
examples.en: This are three days a week when I work.
I am three years old.

senses.grammar_hint: Тринадцать is used as a numeral in both cardinal and ordinal forms, for example: тринадцатый день (thirteenth day).

examples.en: I am thirty years old.
This is my thirteenth birthday.

examples.ru: Максимальная температура воздуха сегодня составила двадцать пять градусов.
examples.en: The maximum temperature today was twenty-five degrees.

examples.ru: Убедитесь, что температура воды не превышает тридцать градусов Цельсия.
examples.en: Make sure the water temperature does not exceed thirty degrees Celsius.

examples.ru: Пациент обратился к врачу из-за повышения температуры тела.
examples.en: The patient consulted a doctor due to fever.

senses.grammar_hint: Триста is used to denote a specific quantity, such as age, score, or number of items.

examples.en: He is three hundred years old.

examples.ru: Она получила триста рублей за победу в конкурсе.
examples.en: She received three hundred rubles for winning the contest.
There were three hundred people in the cinema.

examples.ru: Я ехал на троллейбусе до работы.
examples.en: I went to work on the trolleybus.
There are many trolleybuses in our city.

examples.ru: Мне нужно было сесть на троллейбус у остановки «Свободы».
examples.en: I needed to get on the trolleybus at the 'Freedom' stop.

senses.grammar_hint: The adjective трудный is used to describe nouns in the masculine singular nominative form, such as трудный день (a difficult day).

examples.en: This test is very difficult.
He had a difficult choice to make.

examples.ru: Трудные условия работы ухудшают качество продукции.
examples.en: Difficult working conditions worsen the quality of the product.

senses.grammar_hint: Туда is used to indicate a direction or place, often in response to a question asking where something is.

examples.en: Where is the park? — It's over there.
The bus goes __there__.
We went there to buy bread.
I am a tourist from Moscow.
We came here as tourists.
Tourists like to visit landmarks.

senses.usage_notes: This adverb can be used to indicate a place or time, such as 'тут было солнечно' (it was sunny here) or 'тут жил его дедушка' (his grandfather lived here).

examples.en: My book is here.
I found my mistake right here.
It's always quiet here.

senses.usage_notes: Used to address someone informally.

examples.en: You are a smart person.
You can come tomorrow.
Do you like cats?
Parents sent the child on transport.

examples.ru: Мы путешествуем по городу с помощью общественного транспорта.
examples.en: We travel around the city using public transport.

examples.ru: Пробки часто создают проблемы для местного транспорта.
examples.en: Traffic jams often create problems for local transport.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used in both formal and informal contexts.

examples.en: I had pleasure from playing.

examples.ru: Он не получает никакого удовольствия от работы.
examples.en: He gets no pleasure from work.
Pleasure is a nice feeling.

senses.grammar_hint: Use уже́ when you want to indicate that something has happened or is true before a certain point in time.

examples.ru: Уже́ пять вече́ра, а я все еще́ не до́лжен быть дома́.
examples.en: It's already five o'clock, but I'm still not supposed to be home yet.
We'll start the new project already tomorrow.

examples.ru: Уже́ три годы́, как мы знае́м друг дру́га.
examples.en: We've known each other already for three years.

senses.grammar_hint: Ужин is used to refer to an evening meal, typically eaten in the late afternoon or early evening.

examples.en: Today's dinner will be late.

examples.ru: Мы приготовили ужин, пока вы были на работе.
examples.en: We prepared dinner while you were at work.

examples.ru: Ужин в ресторане будет стоить примерно столько же, сколько обед в обычном кафе.
examples.en: Dinner in a restaurant will cost about the same as lunch in an ordinary café.

source.seed_translation: to, at, by, from 1) Let’s meet by the store. 2) I have this book. 3) I was at doctor’s. 4) She learnt cooking from her mother. 5) We need to find out from Ivan about the concert.
source.seed_extra_ru: с р.п. 1) где? — Встре́тимся у магази́на. 2) у кого? — У меня́ есть э́та кни́га. 3) где? (у кого?) — Я был у до́ктора. 4) у кого? — Она́ учи́лась гото́вить у ма́мы. 5) у кого? — О конце́рте на́до узна́ть у Ива́на.

senses.usage_notes: This preposition 'у' is often used to indicate location or time.
senses.grammar_hint: Pay attention to its different uses in Russian, such as expressing proximity or a specific point in time.

examples.en: I live by the river.

examples.ru: У нас сегодня встреча в шесть.
examples.en: We have a meeting at six today.
He came in the morning.
I live on Sadovaya Street.

examples.ru: Улица была пуста в это время суток.
examples.en: The street was empty at this time of day.

examples.ru: Мы встретились у входа на улицу.
examples.en: We met at the entrance to the street.

senses.grammar_hint: The adjective 'умный' is used to describe a person or their actions as clever or smart.

examples.en: He is a clever person.

examples.ru: У неё умные ответы на все вопросы.
examples.en: She has clever answers to all questions.

examples.ru: Этот метод решения задачи очень умный.
examples.en: This method of solving the problem is very clever.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used both as a singular countable noun and in its plural form (universities).

examples.en: I am studying at the university.

examples.ru: Моя мечта – поступить в престижный университет.
examples.en: My dream is to get into a prestigious university.

examples.ru: В этом городе есть несколько университетов.
examples.en: There are several universities in this city.

senses.grammar_hint: This noun is in the accusative case when used as a direct object, for example: Я делаю упражнение (I do an exercise).

examples.en: I did many exercises.

examples.ru: Это упражнение поможет тебе улучшить форму.
examples.en: This exercise will help you improve your shape.

examples.ru: Мне нужно делать упражнения регулярно для поддержания здоровья.
examples.en: I need to do exercises regularly to maintain my health.

senses.usage_notes: This verb is used to describe having dinner in the evening.

examples.en: I have supper at seven o'clock.

examples.ru: Мы обычно ужинаем вместе с родителями.
examples.en: We usually have supper together with our parents.

examples.ru: Если хочешь, мы можем ужинать в кафетерии.
examples.en: If you want, we can have supper in the cafeteria.

senses.usage_notes: Урок usually refers to a class or lesson in school.

examples.en: I prepared for my math lesson.

examples.ru: Мы провели урок по изучению новой темы.
examples.en: We had a lesson on the new topic.
The lesson started at 9 o'clock.
Good morning!
In the morning, I drink tea.
Mornings are wiser than evenings.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'тысяча' is used in plural form as 'тысячи' or 'тысяч', depending on the context and the following word.

examples.ru: В этой библиотеке есть тысяча книг.
examples.en: This library has a thousand books.

examples.ru: Мне нужны две тысячи рублей для поездки.
examples.en: I need two thousand rubles for the trip.

examples.ru: Они работали тысячу часов без перерыва.
examples.en: They worked a thousand hours without a break.

senses.grammar_hint: утром is commonly used as an adverb to indicate time, often at the beginning of a sentence or clause.

examples.en: In the morning, I drink coffee.
In the morning, you need to get up early.

examples.ru: Утром мы обычно гуляем с собакой.
examples.en: In the morning, we usually take a walk with our dog.

examples.ru: Я беру учебник для подготовки к экзамену.
examples.en: I take the textbook for exam preparation.
The textbook is on the table.

examples.ru: Этот учебник очень полезен для понимания предмета.
examples.en: This textbook is very helpful for understanding the subject.

senses.grammar_hint: The noun 'ученик' is masculine in gender, so it agrees with masculine adjectives and pronouns.

examples.en: I am a pupil.
This is my old pupil.
The teacher checked all the pupils.

senses.grammar_hint: The word 'ученица' is a feminine noun, used for girls or young women who are students.

examples.en: My daughter is a pupil of this school.

examples.ru: Ученицы пишут экзамен в конце учебного года.
examples.en: The female students take the exam at the end of the academic year.

examples.ru: Моя сестра была ученицей десять лет назад.
examples.en: My sister was a pupil ten years ago.

senses.usage_notes: This noun is used to refer to a person who has extensive knowledge in a specific field, such as physics or biology.

examples.en: The scientist conducted research.
She always dreamed of becoming a scientist.
We were impressed by the scientists' lectures.

senses.usage_notes: This noun is used to refer to a male teacher in formal or casual conversation.

examples.en: The teacher came to class.

examples.ru: Мой учитель всегда готов помочь мне с домашним заданием.
examples.en: My teacher is always ready to help me with homework.
I respect my teacher very much.

examples.ru: Я учительница математики в нашей школе.
examples.en: I am a math teacher at our school.
My mom works as a teacher.
The teacher told us an interesting story.

senses.grammar_hint: This verb can be used in both present and future tense, for example: Я учусь на курсе по русскому языку (I am studying Russian on a course).

examples.en: I am learning the language.

examples.ru: Мы будем учить новое слово каждый день.
examples.en: We will learn a new word every day.

senses.grammar_hint: The verb 'учиться' is used in the infinitive form, often with the particle 'быть', to indicate studying as a way of life or habit.

examples.en: I study at university.
She is studying to be a doctor.
We studied together.

senses.grammar_hint: The noun 'факультет' is masculine in gender.

examples.en: I am studying at the faculty of law.
The university has several large faculties.
I work at the faculty of psychology.

examples.ru: Он не хотел, чтобы его фамилия была связана с этим скандалом.
examples.en: He didn't want his family name to be associated with this scandal.

examples.ru: Это имя является частью его фамилии, но оно имеет другой смысл.
examples.en: This name is part of his surname, but it has another meaning.

examples.ru: Имя Сергеев стало известным благодаря знаменитому писателю Сергееву.
examples.en: The surname Sergeyev became famous thanks to the famous writer Sergeyev.
February is a winter month.

examples.ru: В феврале у нас часто бывают морозы.
examples.en: It's often very cold in February here.

examples.ru: День рождения у меня в начале февраля.
examples.en: My birthday is at the beginning of February.

examples.ru: Моя сестра учится на физике в университете.
examples.en: My sister studies physics at university.

examples.ru: У меня друг увлекается теорией относительности, которая изучается в физике.
examples.en: My friend is interested in the theory of relativity, which is studied in physics.

examples.ru: В нашем классе есть хороший ученый-физик.
examples.en: There's a good scientist who specializes in physics in our class.

examples.ru: Его увлекает изучение древних языков, поэтому он решил стать филологом.
examples.en: He is fascinated by the study of ancient languages, so he decided to become a philologist.

examples.ru: Иван выбрал специализацию по славистике, поскольку ему интересна история славянских языков и культуры.
examples.en: Ivan chose to specialize in Slavistics because he is interested in the history of Slavic languages and cultures.

examples.ru: Моя тётя работает в университете как филолог, преподавая русский язык.
examples.en: My aunt works as a philologist at a university, teaching Russian language.

senses.usage_notes: This word can be used in a sentence like 'Я люблю смотреть фильмы.' (I love watching films.).

examples.en: Tonight I will watch a film.
My favorite movie is 'Die Hard'.

examples.ru: В кинотеатре будут показывать новый фильм.
examples.en: The cinema will be showing a new film.

senses.usage_notes: This word can refer to a company or business entity.

examples.en: I work in a company.

examples.ru: Это крупнаяfirmа, она работает на рынке более десяти лет.
examples.en: This is a large firm that has been working on the market for over ten years.
My firm specializes in electronics production.

examples.ru: Я взял фотоаппарат с собой на пикник.
